headline.main: HOUSE COMMITTEE BARS FISH SUMMONS; But Leaves Way Open for Him to Testify to Grand Jury Under Certain Conditions PRIVILEGE HELD INVADED Detention by Prosecutor Is at Issue -- Celler Takes View Colleague Should Appear

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 (AP) -- The House judiciary committee decided today that a grand jury subpoena served on Representative Fish violated the rights and privileges of the House, but added that the House could waive those privileges under such conditions as it might determine.
abstract: com rules subpoena violates House rights but permits House to waive privileges
